on-primary.description: Primary Color The color used for content (icon, text, etc.) located above the surface.

primary.description: A color that is used for major actions in the service or that expresses the brand's personality

primary-event.description:
Tokens that represent changes in the default color state when the user presses or controls the screen with a mouse or finger. 
It replaces hovered in a desktop environment. 
In a mobile environment, it replaces the pressed.

negative.description: A color used for negative situations such as errors or errors. This color should not be used frequently.

negative-event.description:
Tokens that represent changes in the negative color state when the user presses or controls the screen with a mouse or finger. 
It replaces hovered in a desktop environment. 
In a mobile environment, it replaces the pressed.

positive.description: Color used for positive state representations such as success, completion, and so on.

disabled.description: This is a color that means the disabled state of the ui.

disabled-low.description: Represents a step in a hierarchy below the default deactivation status color.

on-surface.description: used for content such as letters and icons that are placed above the surface color.
